Create a fire-resistant barrier: You could create a fire-resistant barrier around your home by using materials such as brick, concrete, or fire-resistant drywall. This would help to prevent the fire from spreading to other parts of the house.

Install smoke detectors and sprinkler systems: Smoke detectors can detect smoke early and alert you to evacuate your home. Sprinkler systems can help to extinguish small fires before they become larger.
Keep a fire extinguisher on hand: While sprinkler systems are great for larger fires, it's always a good idea to have a fire extinguisher on hand in case of a small fire.
Create a fire-resistant plan: Create a fire-resistant plan that outlines what to do in case of a fire. This should include evacuation routes, meeting points, and emergency contact information.
Use fire-resistant materials: Use fire-resistant materials when building or renovating your home. This can include fire-resistant drywall, fire-resistant insulation, and fire-resistant flooring.
